# ObjectAnchor

**Structure**

A reference object ARKit is tracking.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ObjectAnchor
```

## Overview

You use object anchors to learn about the position and orientation of a real-world object.

## Inspecting an object anchor

- **boundingBox**: The bounding box of an anchor.
- **ObjectAnchor.AxisAlignedBoundingBox**: Values that describe an axis-aligned bounding box.
- **description**: A textual representation of this anchor.
- **isTracked**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the framework is currently tracking an object anchor.
- **originFromAnchorTransform**: The transform from the object anchor to the origin coordinate system.
- **referenceObject**: The reference object that an anchor corresponds to.
- **inputFile**: The input file the framework uses for loading a reference object.
- **usdzFile**: The trained USDZ file, if the reference object includes one.
- **ReferenceObject**: An object the framework can track.

## Inspecting and comparing anchors

- **id**: The unique identifier of this anchor.
- **ObjectAnchor.ID**: A type representing the stable identity of the entity associated with an instance.

## Object tracking

- **ObjectTrackingProvider**: A source of real-time position of reference objects in a person’s environment.
- **Exploring object tracking with ARKit**: Find and track real-world objects in visionOS using reference objects trained with Create ML.
- **Implementing object tracking in your visionOS app**: Create engaging interactions by training models to recognize and track real-world objects in your app.

## Conforms To

- Anchor
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Identifiable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- TrackableAnchor
